instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 Macbook air Display not going to sleep
threads.message: working on a 820-3437 computer works fine hardware test comes up fine but computer will not go to sleep any ideas where to look .

threads.title: 820-3437 Macbook air Display not going to sleep
threads.message: LID switch is on I/O board, inspect for water damage, also check de cable and connectors.......

threads.title: 820-3437 Macbook air Display not going to sleep
threads.message: i tried another io board and cable same issue

threads.title: 820-3437 Macbook air Display not going to sleep
threads.message: i also forgot to mention there is no audio either that's why i tried replacing the io board.

threads.title: 820-3437 Macbook air Display not going to sleep
threads.message:
Did you try compatible LIO board?
Measure SMC_LID on MLB, when lid is closed.

threads.title: 820-3437 Macbook air Display not going to sleep
threads.message: SMC _LID is 0v when closed when i open lid its 3.4xx volts which seems to be normal but the display stays on and will not go to sleep

threads.title: 820-3437 Macbook air Display not going to sleep
threads.message: Does anyone know what puts the display to sleep, that seems to be the issue here. i see the keyboard goes to sleep but the lcd does not .

threads.title: 820-3437 Macbook air Display not going to sleep
threads.message:
Check EDP_BKLT_EN with lid closed.
Also check if Q7706 is not shorted...
